text: Don't think this is possible using just `AveragedField` and `FieldSlicer` as field slicing acts on the final result (in this case, it acts after the average has been computed).

text:
I think you'll have to define a custom function that does something like
```function custom_average(model)
    U = AveragedField(model.velocities.u, dims=1)
    compute!(U)    
    U_slice_averaged = mean(U.data[1, 20:50, 1:<http://grid.Nz|grid.Nz>], dims=2)
    return U_slice_averaged
end```
but this is pretty hacky...

elements.text: I think you'll have to define a custom function that does something like

function custom_average(model)
    U = AveragedField(model.velocities.u, dims=1)
    compute!(U)    
    U_slice_averaged = mean(U.data[1, 20:50, 1:grid.Nz], dims=2)
    return U_slice_averaged
end

text: `custom_average` can be passed to a `JLD2OutputWriter` or a `NetCDFOutputWriter` (but you probably have to specify the dimensions manually for NetCDF).

elements.text: (but you probably have to specify the dimensions manually for NetCDF).

text: Late to the party!

I think `WindowedField` would be pretty neat. But the primary reason to make something a “Field” is so that it can be used in other operations. Thus `WindowedField` makes the most sense if we need to do complex / heavy operations but only want to perform them on part of some huge model domain. So I think we’ll eventually want this for massive GPU runs. For Tomas’ case though I think a custom averaging function makes more sense. The “windowed spatial average” doesn’t need to be used in any subsequent operations right?

elements.text: would be pretty neat. But the primary reason to make something a “Field” is so that it can be used in other operations. Thus

makes the most sense if we need to do complex / heavy operations but only want to perform them on part of some huge model domain. So I think we’ll eventually want this for massive GPU runs. For Tomas’ case though I think a custom averaging function makes more sense. The “windowed spatial average” doesn’t need to be used in any subsequent operations right?

text: We designed the time averaging feature so that it can time-average any kind of output; so it can average both fields and output of functions (if those functions return arrays). However, field slicer will not work anymore because it can only work on fields.

elements.text: We designed the time averaging feature so that it can time-average any kind of output; so it can average both fields and output of functions (if those functions return arrays). However, field slicer will not work anymore because it can only work on fields.

text:
<@U01E0U2RJJ2> I wonder if `WindowedField` is the place to start? It could be created from a `Field` + a `FieldSlicer`:
```u_window = WindowedField(model.velocities.u, field_slicer=FieldSlicer(j=20:50))```
and we could make sure that
```AveragedField(u_window, dims=(1, 2))```
does the right thing by averaging all of x and y from j=20:50?
